Rune spears may also be smithed with 90 Smithing (requires one runite bar and one magic log, as well as partial completion of Barbarian Training). Like most spears, the rune spear can be poisoned.

The rune spear is a two-handed melee weapon. Unlike most other rune equipment, rune spears are members-only. Rune spears may also be smithed with 90 Smithing (requires one runite bar and one magic log, as well as partial completion of Barbarian Training). Like most spears, the rune spear can be poisoned.

A rune spear is also a requirement for a hard clue scroll. Ironmen can acquire it by completing Tai Bwo Wannai Trio for a rune spear (kp) after using a cleaning cloth on it or buying it from Mount Karuulm Weapon Shop.

This item is a rare drop from the rare drop table. Wearing a ring of wealth will increase the chances of receiving one from the rare drop table.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
21 April 2021
(update)

The spear's attack speed has been decreased from 6 (every 3.6 seconds) to 4 (every 2.4 seconds).

22 August 2006
(update)
  • The extra strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Rune spear(+)" to "Rune spear(p+)".
  • The super strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Rune spear(s)" to "Rune spear(p++)".

The '''rune spear''' is a two-handed [[melee weapon]]. Unlike most other [[rune equipment]], rune spears are [[members]]-only. Rune spears may also be smithed with 90 [[Smithing]] (requires one [[runite bar]] and one [[magic log]], as well as partial completion of [[Barbarian Training]]). Like most spears, the rune spear can be [[poison]]ed.

A rune spear is also a requirement for a [[Clue scroll (hard)|hard clue scroll]]. [[Ironmen]] can acquire it by completing [[Tai Bwo Wannai Trio]] for a rune spear (kp) after using a [[cleaning cloth]] on it or buying it from [[Mount Karuulm Weapon Shop]].

This item is a rare drop from the [[rare drop table]]. Wearing a [[ring of wealth]] will increase the chances of receiving one from the rare drop table.
